before.chText: 通常与can、could或be able to连用，尤用于否定句或疑问句
before.enText: usually used with can , could or be able to , especially in negative sentences or questions

data.enText: to have enough money or time to be able to buy or to do sth

data.chText: 我们买得起一辆新车吗？
data.enText: Can we afford a new car?

data.chText: 他们中没有哪个拿得出50英镑买一张票。
data.enText: None of them could afford £50 for a ticket.

data.chText: 她觉得再也抽不出时间歇班了。
data.enText: She felt she couldn't afford any more time off work.

data.chText: 今年夏天我们没有足够的钱去国外。
data.enText: We can't afford to go abroad this summer.

data.chText: 尽管她坐得起出租汽车，但她从未坐过。
data.enText: She never took a taxi, even though she could afford to.

data.chText: 他不够钱去进行这次旅行。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: He couldn't afford the money to go on the trip.

before.chText: 通常与can或could连用，尤用于否定句或疑问句
before.enText: usually used with can or could , especially in negative sentences and questions

data.enText: if you say that you can't afford to do sth, you mean that you should not do it because it will cause problems for you if you do

data.chText: 我们对这个警告绝不能等闲视之。
data.enText: We cannot afford to ignore this warning.

data.chText: 他们再也不能损失员工了。
data.enText: They could ill afford to lose any more staff.

data.chText: 我们不能再有任何耽搁了。
data.enText: We cannot afford any more delays.

data.chText: 这棵树可以挡一挡太阳。
data.enText: The tree affords some shelter from the sun.

data.chText: 这项计划给年轻人提供了获得工作经验的机会。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: The programme affords young people the chance to gain work experience.

data.chText: 付得起的价格；买得起的住宅

ex.enText: The manager offered him a cigarette.

ex.chText: 他给她提供了一份好工作，但她拒绝了。
ex.enText: He offered her a good job, but she turned it down.

synonyms.bx: 指主动给予帮助等，对方可以接受也可以拒绝。

ex.chText: 这房间可以看到迷人的海景。
ex.enText: The room affords a fascinating sea view.

ex.chText: 这给了他与外国的同龄人交流的机会。
ex.enText: It afforded him the opportunity to communicate with his foreign peers.

synonyms.bx: 多指提供抽象的东西，可后接双宾语。

ex.chText: 这些新的发现是否会提供更多与案件有关的线索？
ex.enText: Will these new finds furnish more clues surrounding the case?

ex.chText: 他得到了一份当地经销商的名单。
ex.enText: He was furnished with a list of local dealers.

synonyms.bx: 既可指提供抽象的东西，又可指提供具体的东西。

ex.chText: 这家餐厅为客人提供免费甜点。
ex.enText: The restaurant provides free desserts for guests.

ex.chText: 他们已给我提供了所需要的一切。
ex.enText: They have already provided me with everything I need.

ex.chText: 孩子们有良好的衣食供应。
ex.enText: The kids are provided with good food and clothing.

ex.chText: 当局有义务为老年人提供住所。
ex.enText: It is the duty of the authorities to provide homes for the old.

synonyms.bx: 指为某人提供需要或有用的东西，多用于 provide sth for sb 和provide sb with sth 结构中。

ex.chText: 这个项目所用的钢材由一家国际公司提供。
ex.enText: Steel for this project was supplied by an international company.

ex.chText: 他们因为向街头小贩提供假药而被捕。
ex.enText: They were arrested for supplying counterfeit medicine to street vendors.

ex.chText: 我们给附近的5个城镇提供电力。
ex.enText: We supply power to the five nearby towns.

synonyms.bx: 尤指长时间地定期供应所需或想要之物，多用于 supply sb with sth 和 supply sth to sb 结构中。

tr: be able to spare or give up
example: I can't afford to spend two hours with this person

tr: be the cause or source of
example: He gave me a lot of trouble
Our meeting afforded much interesting information
the door opens to the patio
The French doors give onto a terrace

tr: have the financial means to do something or buy something
example: We can't afford to send our children to college

value.def: If you cannot afford something, you do not have enough money to pay for it.

example.ex: My parents can't even afford a new refrigerator...
example.tran: 我父母甚至买不起一台新冰箱。

example.ex: The arts should be available to more people at prices they can afford...
example.tran: 艺术品应该以人们能够承受的价格面向更多的人出售。

example.ex: We couldn't afford to buy a new rug.
example.tran: 我们买不起新的小地毯。

value.def: If you say that you cannot afford to do something or allow it to happen, you mean that you must not do it or must prevent it from happening because it would be harmful or embarrassing to you.

example.ex: The country could not afford the luxury of an election.
example.tran: 该国负担不起选举这样奢侈的事。

value.def: If someone or something affords you an opportunity or protection, they give it to you.

example.ex: This affords us the opportunity to ask questions about how the systems might change...
example.tran: 这给我们提供了就系统可能如何改变进行提问的机会。

example.ex: It was a cold room, but it afforded a fine view of the Old City.
example.tran: 这房间虽然很冷，但是它能让人将古城的景致尽收眼底。

trans: 买得起；负担得起；支付得起；有能力购买；能负担
